Articles.Content:
Hallo,

I recently launched a relay satellite network, everythink seemed fine.  But after doing some other stuff and some time warp, I saw that 2 out of 9 satellites where not on position. Both satellites where behind the position they actually should be, by such an amount that they are actually pretty close to the satellite following up.

Rechecking orbits with micro engineer ( I also brought them to orbit with that tool), they have no deviation that would explain that behaviour, AP and EP differ by maximum 2km(0,3%, AP and EP~600km) and the period time is the same for all satellites  to the second. 

Is there anything I am missing that would explain such a deviation, or has anybody observed something similar?

 

Best regards
